common_issues.title: Pieces OS connectivity issues across VS Code and Chrome extensions
common_issues.description: Users report various connectivity problems with Pieces OS 11.4.2 on Windows.  VS Code extensions fail to connect, showing empty settings or errors related to custom URLs and version strings. Chrome extensions also experience connection failures and outdated version messages.  Potential solutions include verifying network settings, checking Pieces OS and extension versions, and ensuring proper communication between Pieces OS, VS Code, and Chrome extensions.

related_issues.title: WSL cannot connect to Pieces OS in VS Code
related_issues.text:
WSL cannot connect to Pieces OS in VS Code
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to use Pieces extensions in VS Code for WSL:Ubuntu. Piesces Setting window is empty, but earlier it showed two buttons Launch and Install and when you click on Install, for example, VS Code shows notification that it can't connect to Pieces OS. I tried multiple fixes I found. One is to set Custom URL for Remote environment and I tried with <Windows IP>:1000 and with NGrok forwarding of same url, both without success and I could reach both with curl. There are some errors in VS Code Developer tools related to Pieces OS extension:

Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: version is longer than 256 characters
at new it (settingsView.js:1:5120)
at UH (settingsView.js:1:9927)
at Object.tU (settingsView.js:1:10530)
at vN (settingsView.js:19:354749)

at
https://vscode-remote+wsl-002bubuntu.vscode-resource.vscode-cdn.net/home/vladan/.vscode-server/extensions/meshintelligenttechnologiesinc.pieces-vscode-2.0.6/dist/settingsView.js

and Pieces OS log shows error:

GET     [404] /assets/stream/identifiers: port:Instance of 'Future<int>': (2nd server)


Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App and Plugin Issues on macOS and Windows
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the Pieces desktop application and Chrome plugin on macOS and Windows.  Problems include keyboard shortcuts not working on macOS, plugin connection and functionality issues on Windows, and the desktop app periodically jumping to the main monitor on macOS.  Troubleshooting steps include checking for plugin updates and reinstalling the desktop application.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.0.0 Update and Plugin Compatibility Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS 11.0.0 and its plugins. Some plugins are outdated or not functioning correctly after the update.  The Chrome extension, for example, has reported connection problems. Users should ensure all plugins are updated to the latest versions (Desktop App: 3.3.0, Pieces OS: 11.0.0, VSCode: 2.0.0, JetBrains: 11.0.0, Visual Studio: 4.0.0, Jupyter: 1.21.0, Obsidian: 1.21.0, Sublime: 1.5.0, CLI: 1.9.0, NeoVim: 1.3.0, Chrome Extension: 4.0.0). Performance issues with VS Code have also been reported while Pieces OS is running.

related_issues.title: Announcement: 11.0.0 POS Breaking Change - TLDR: please update all plugins
related_issues.text:
Announcement: 11.0.0 POS Breaking Change - TLDR: please update all plugins
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, Web Extension, JetBrains, VS Code, Visual Studio, Obsidian, JupyterLab, Sublime Plugin, Raycast Extension, Pieces CLI, Neovim

### Operating System / Platform

macOS/Windows/Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey 👋,

We introduce one of the largest releases in the Pieces Ecosystem.

Lots of bug fixes - targeting some of the largest hitches in the user journey to name a few: rate limiting(authenticate to bypass, + better error messaging), entirely new Ollama (local LLM) infrastructure w/ in the copilot, and tackling installation head-on.

The detailed list of changes is not quite ready yet; however, it will be here shortly. (I will post them here when they are)

However, this issue is here let you know to update all your plugins and provide the status of all of the new plugins(in the case they are not yet out in production)

Pieces For Developers(Desktop Application): 3.3.0 - Live
PiecesOs: 11.0.0 - Live
vscode: 2.0.0 - Live
JetBrains: 11.0.0 - Live
Visual Studio: 4.0.0 - Live
Jupyter: 1.21.0 - Live
Obsidian: 1.21.0 - Live
Sublime: 1.5.0 - Live
CLI: - 1.9.0 Live
NeoVim: - 1.3.0 Live
Chrome(web) Extension: - 4.0.0 (This is under review)

Please, if you have any questions about the release or are having trouble updating to the latest, comment in this thread, and we can help you out!!

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.4.2 performance issues and Copilot integration bugs
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing performance issues with Pieces OS 11.4.2, including VS Code slowdowns and unresponsiveness.  Additionally, Copilot's create_memory_pieces tool is failing, sometimes with connection drops. Chat responses are also delayed or absent. The create_memory tool issue will be resolved in Pieces OS 11.4.3.

related_issues.title: bug: create memory via mcp(resolved in next release 11.4.3)

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.4.2: Slow or no response to chat, image pasting fails
common_issues.description: Users report slow or no responses from chat, primarily using GPT-4.1 on Windows in Pieces OS 11.4.2.  Pasting images results in "Uuups" errors.  Issue affects Desktop Application, VS Code, and Visual Studio integrations.  Error messages suggest a potential issue with the Gemini-Pro model access.

recommendations: Prioritize resolving connectivity issues between Pieces OS and plugins (VS Code, Chrome).  This appears to be the most frequent and impactful problem.
Investigate performance issues with Pieces OS 11.4.2, especially VS Code slowdowns, and ensure the 11.4.3 update addresses Copilot and chat response problems.
Update documentation and messaging around Pieces OS updates and plugin compatibility to minimize disruption after releases.
Improve error messaging and troubleshooting steps for connectivity problems, including network settings, version checks, and communication between Pieces OS and extensions.
Address the "Uuups" error when pasting images, potentially related to Gemini-Pro model access.
Review and address issues with keyboard shortcuts on macOS and the desktop app's focus behavior.
Monitor and address the issue of Long Term Memory (LTM) periodically turning off.
Investigate Pieces Copilot's inaccurate LTM information and date display.
Clarify the functionality of "Clear Long Term Memory Data" and ensure it removes captured context and workstream activity as expected.
Proactively communicate known issues and their resolutions to users through release notes, FAQs, or other channels.
Gather more data on the specific causes of connectivity issues to identify patterns and implement targeted solutions.
Consider automated checks for plugin compatibility with Pieces OS updates to prevent future issues.
Implement performance monitoring and alerting for Pieces OS and its integrations to detect and address issues quickly.
Review user feedback and prioritize bug fixes based on frequency and impact on user workflows.
Improve the chat response time and reliability, especially for GPT-4.1 on Windows with Pieces OS 11.4.2.
